title: Newcastle United concerns about PSR ? Maybe for a year or two but not for long …
body_text:
Newcastle United concerns about PSR? Maybe for a year or two but not for long…
Now we are in between seasons, we wanted to get a Newcastle United fans snapshot of opinion.
The idea is to get a range of views of what various Mag writers (Newcastle United fans) think about what has happened and the current position.
Then most importantly, what is going to happen at Newcastle United moving forward.
So we have sent various regular and irregular contributors sets of questions, including some the same as others, some different.
Next up we have Rex N:
How worried are you about PSR/FFP affecting Newcastle United’s chances in the 2024/25 season?
From a recent article that The Mag were kind enough to host, it might be obvious that I am chilled overall.
There is enough value in older players to generate sufficient funds to provide development, combined with the Staveley consortium generating extra sponsorship and commercial revenues. We also have a market that Ashworth was unable to incorporate, out of contract players.
How worried are you about PSR/FFP affecting Newcastle United over the course of the next decade?
Let’s start by saying revenues have increased from £140 million under Ashely to significantly over £300 million under new ownership. I don’t think that accounts for the current year will contradict that assertion.
Just an example but the Saudi PIF have a stake in Carnival Cruises, amongst other high value tertiary/service industries. The wage ratio has already come down from around 95% to about 75%.
What better way to do a pre-season tour of Australia and Japan than on a cruise after a flight on a Saudi airline?
FFP, PRS and any future guise will change. The system is not fit for purpose but may become so.
Worried? Maybe for a year or two but not for long.
Three words to describe how you currently feel as a Newcastle fan?
Short term, “twitchy“. What will happen in the transfer market this year?
Medium term, “cautious“, knowing that there are some tough decisions on squad with top defenders out for the start of next season and aware of financial constraints.
Longer term “excited” seeing how the current ownership consortium has invested wisely in the squad, boosted revenues and knowing there is more to come.
Three words to describe Eddie Howe?
“Best British manager”, justified by league tables.
I was tempted to have one of the words as “God”, since Bruno told us his future is in God’s hands.
KK had that status and I’ll give Eddie the leeway to prove that he can be more omnipotent than the last God.
Is it still a Premier League big six, or is it seven (incl NUFC), or is it an eight (incl NUFC and Villa)?
Things change over time.
In Freddie Shepherd’s days I always argued that we should hang on the coat tails and take advantage of any slips from those in the hot seats. It would have been a similar strategy from any of those on the periphery.
For the time being, it looks like a big three, obviously Man City (once nowhere near the four), Arsenal (back in after finally getting a post-Wenger direction) and the former Liverpool manager, Klopp, remembering that Rafa also won a Champions League with them.
Man U no longer have Ferguson but have revenues. Despite that, they can’t afford to pay adequate compo for a Sporting Director so can they realistically be counted?
The Russian rug has been pulled from under Chelsea.
Spurs did OK this year but can they push on? They don’t have another Kane to sell.
Villa have a manager we shortlisted.
OK, it’s me being me but there is that top three. We are among the challengers.
None of the rest of us can claim anything, probably for the next few seasons until any of us can achieve Champions League qualification for a few years in a row – but let’s enjoy the battle.
What do you think Eddie Howe’s first choice eleven will be next season, with all the current squad available and the summer signings you think will be made. So if you think in a position a summer signing will be Eddie’s first choice, please just put ‘summer signing’.
Which part of the season do we mean? It will change over time as Eddie gives players a chance to adapt to the Premier League.
Sorry about the qualifications but the situation will be fluid, particularly carrying injuries:
Pope
Livramento, Schar, Burn/Kelly/Botman(?) Hall
Tonali, Joelinton, Bruno/Rabiot/Miley (depending on transfer market)
Raphina, Isak, Gordon (or Barnes if the Liverpool connection has not been overhyped).
As for the bench, it’s Fantasy Football time.
What do you see as the minimum this season?
Expecting investment, pressure will be on Eddie.
Presuming he will be backed, Europa League, whether by league position or a domestic cup (without relegation).
Hand on heart, where do you think Newcastle will finish in the 2024/25 Premier League?
It will change over time but without UEFA distractions and the injuries that can go with it, top five.
The best five NUFC performances last season (in order)?
You have to put home to PSG at the top of the list.
ManUre away in the League Cup hinted at breaking the mould
West Ham at home was a marker for resilience
Completing the double over Villa hinted at better things
The Spurs demolition, another Septic target.
Outside those top five, the eight goals from eight players against Sheffield United hinted at a top four place had we not suffered so much through injuries, culminating in a record Premier league tally against the same opponent home and away.
The five most important Newcastle players for this 2024/25 season (in order)?
The Mag can set challenging tasks!
Joelinton, given how we suffered from his absence.
Bruno, especially avoiding a suspension in the second half of the season.
Isak, whose goals make him a realistic challenger for the two places above him.
Gordon for threat and consistency and a good challenger for any of the places above him.
Schar for his consistency after having been written off by some pie muncher who once managed NUFC.
What do you think should happen with VAR, what changes or get rid of altogether?
Learn from where other sports have been successful, such as tennis, cricket and mostly rugby.
Firstly, change the rules so that if a foot overlaps with the defender, benefit of the doubt is given to the attacking side so onside. At the same time, adopt semi-automated offsides.
Decisions to be made public over the stadium PA system.
Both sides to be allowed three appeals per half, an extra appeal per half in extra time in cup competitions. If an appeal is considered “vexatious”, the team captain can be given a yellow card.
If a decision can not be made within a minute, including at least three camera angles, the decision is not “clear and obvious”.
Press a magic button and have a 62,000 capacity enlarged St James’ Park in place, or a brand new 80,000 capacity stadium just up the road at Castle Leazes ?
A subject close to my heart.
When tickets have been available, my kids get priority. So being greedy, more chance to go myself if we got the 80,000 stadium. Memories are with my late father at the current SJP.
Ultimately, the higher figure is best for the future of the club, even if it can’t be at the current SJP. With the Reubens having invested in Newcastle as a whole, there could be extra spin-offs for hotels and conference facilities being integrated into a totally new stadium.
At the risk of stirring a hornets’ nest, I would be happy with a “Sela St James’ Park” hosting concerts, rugby, cricket, boxing events if it gives us an edge.
If we ask a different question for our kids, we may come up with a different answer to the one which tugs at our heart strings. Will the current SJP be adequate when my children introduce their children to NUFC? There is only one answer and I would like my ashes to be scattered at our future long-term home.
Upcoming 2024/25 season, would you rather win League Cup or finish Premier League top four?
Top four gives us the ability to invest and reinvest.
As things stand, what could this NUFC squad be capable of next season?
This squad, top eight. With a few additions, top four. The key will be who we buy to improve on the older squad members that we sell.
Your thoughts on Sandro Tonali as he is set to be available to play from the end of August 2024 onwards?
He is a talent, he should be hungry.
One of my biggest mistakes came when I was one of the flavours of the month with Radio 5 and slated Joey Barton for being sent off against Liverpool. His rehabilitation was remarkable. Tonali has manned up and served his punishment. The simple message to Tonali is “inspire us”.
He has my backing and from my social circle, has backing elsewhere.
Scale of 1-10, how interested in England at the Euros?
Interested in two of the 26 man squad, unless we sign anyone else in it. Let’s go for one out of ten.
How much of a difference, if any, does it make having two NUFC players in the squad and/or England playing at SJP for a change in the warm up friendly v Bosnia?
Players in the squad, yes. I hope that SJP hosting generated extra revenue for FFP/PRS purposes.
